refnamediv.refpurpose: Functions for shape engines to manipulate Win32 fonts

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The macros and functions in this section are used to access fonts natively on Win32 systems and to render text in conjunction with Win32 APIs.

refsect2.title: PANGO_RENDER_TYPE_WIN32
refsect2.para: A string constant identifying the Win32 renderer. The associated quark (see g_quark_from_string()) is used to identify the renderer in pango_find_map().

refsect2.title: pango_win32_get_context ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves a PangoContext appropriate for rendering with Windows fonts.

listitem.simpara: the new PangoContext

refsect2.title: pango_win32_render ()
refsect2.programlisting: void pango_win32_render (HDC hdc, PangoFont *font, PangoGlyphString *glyphs, gint x, gint y);
refsect2.para: Render a PangoGlyphString onto a Windows DC

listitem.simpara: the device context
the font in which to draw the string
the glyph string to draw
the x position of start of string (in pixels)
the y position of baseline (in pixels)

refsect2.title: pango_win32_render_transformed ()
refsect2.programlisting: void pango_win32_render_transformed (HDC hdc, const PangoMatrix *matrix, PangoFont *font, PangoGlyphString *glyphs, int x, int y);
refsect2.para: Renders a PangoGlyphString onto a windows DC, possibly transforming the layed-out coordinates through a transformation matrix. Note that the transformation matrix for font is not changed, so to produce correct rendering results, the font must have been loaded using a PangoContext with an identical transformation matrix to that passed in to this function.

listitem.simpara: a windows device context
a PangoMatrix, or NULL to use an identity transformation
the font in which to draw the string
the glyph string to draw
the x position of the start of the string (in Pango units in user space coordinates)
the y position of the baseline (in Pango units in user space coordinates)

refsect2.para: Render a PangoLayoutLine onto a device context. For underlining to work property the text alignment of the DC should have TA_BASELINE and TA_LEFT.

refsect2.title: pango_win32_get_unknown_glyph ()

warning.para: pango_win32_get_unknown_glyph is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Returns the index of a glyph suitable for drawing wc as an unknown character.
Use PANGO_GET_UNKNOWN_GLYPH() instead.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont
the Unicode character for which a glyph is needed.
a glyph index into font

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_get_glyph_index ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the index of the glyph for wc in font, or 0, if not covered.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont.
a Unicode character.
the glyph index for wc.

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_select_font ()
refsect2.para: Selects the font into the specified DC and changes the mapping mode and world transformation of the DC appropriately for the font. You may want to surround the use of this function with calls to SaveDC() and RestoreDC(). Call pango_win32_font_done_font() when you are done using the DC to release allocated resources.
See pango_win32_font_get_metrics_factor() for information about converting from the coordinate space used by this function into Pango units.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont from the Win32 backend
a windows device context
TRUE if the operation succeeded.

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_done_font ()
refsect2.para: Releases any resources allocated by pango_win32_font_done_font()

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont from the win32 backend

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_get_metrics_factor ()
refsect2.para: Returns the scale factor from logical units in the coordinate space used by pango_win32_font_select_font() to Pango units in user space.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont from the win32 backend
factor to multiply logical units by to get Pango units.

refsect2.title: PangoWin32FontCache
refsect2.para: A PangoWin32FontCache caches HFONTs by their LOGFONT descriptions.

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_cache_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a font cache.

listitem.simpara: The new font cache. This must be freed with pango_win32_font_cache_free().

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_cache_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees a PangoWin32FontCache and all associated memory. All fonts loaded through this font cache will be freed along with the cache.

listitem.simpara: a PangoWin32FontCache

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_cache_load ()
refsect2.para: Creates a HFONT from a LOGFONTA. The result may be newly loaded, or it may have been previously stored

listitem.simpara: a PangoWin32FontCache
a pointer to a LOGFONTA structure describing the font to load.
The font structure, or NULL if the font could not be loaded. In order to free this structure, you must call pango_win32_font_cache_unload().

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_cache_loadw ()
refsect2.para: Creates a HFONT from a LOGFONTW. The result may be newly loaded, or it may have been previously stored

listitem.simpara: a PangoWin32FontCache
a pointer to a LOGFONTW structure describing the font to load.
The font structure, or NULL if the font could not be loaded. In order to free this structure, you must call pango_win32_font_cache_unload().

refsect2.para: Since 1.16

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_cache_unload ()
refsect2.para: Frees a font structure previously loaded with pango_win32_font_cache_load().

listitem.simpara: a PangoWin32FontCache
the HFONT to unload

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_map_for_display ()
refsect2.para: Returns a PangoWin32FontMap. Font maps are cached and should not be freed. If the font map is no longer needed, it can be released with pango_win32_shutdown_display().

listitem.simpara: a PangoFontMap.

refsect2.title: pango_win32_shutdown_display ()
refsect2.para: Free cached resources.

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_map_get_font_cache ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the font cache associated with the given font map.

listitem.simpara: a PangoWin32FontMap.
the PangoWin32FontCache of font_map.

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_logfont ()
refsect2.para: Determine the LOGFONTA struct for the specified font. Note that Pango internally uses LOGFONTW structs, so if converting the UTF-16 face name in the LOGFONTW struct to system codepage fails, the returned LOGFONTA will have an emppty face name. To get the LOGFONTW of a PangoFont, use pango_win32_font_logfontw(). It is recommended to do that always even if you don't expect to come across fonts with odd names.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont which must be from the Win32 backend
A newly allocated LOGFONTA struct. It must be freed with g_free().

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_logfontw ()
refsect2.para: Determine the LOGFONTW struct for the specified font.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont which must be from the Win32 backend
A newly allocated LOGFONTW struct. It must be freed with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 1.16

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_description_from_logfont ()
refsect2.para: Creates a PangoFontDescription that matches the specified LOGFONTA.

The face name, italicness and weight fields in the LOGFONTA are used to set up the resulting PangoFontDescription. If the face name in the LOGFONTA contains non-ASCII characters the font is temporarily loaded (using CreateFontIndirect()) and an ASCII (usually English) name for it is looked up from the font name tables in the font data. If that doesn't work, the face name is converted from the system codepage to UTF-8 and that is used.

listitem.simpara: a LOGFONTA
the newly allocated PangoFontDescription, which should be freed using pango_font_description_free()

refsect2.para: Since 1.12

refsect2.title: pango_win32_font_description_from_logfontw ()
refsect2.para: Creates a PangoFontDescription that matches the specified LOGFONTW.

The face name, italicness and weight fields in the LOGFONTW are used to set up the resulting PangoFontDescription. If the face name in the LOGFONTW contains non-ASCII characters the font is temporarily loaded (using CreateFontIndirect()) and an ASCII (usually English) name for it is looked up from the font name tables in the font data. If that doesn't work, the face name is converted from UTF-16 to UTF-8 and that is used.

listitem.simpara: a LOGFONTW
the newly allocated PangoFontDescription, which should be freed using pango_font_description_free()

refsect2.para: Since 1.16
